intro: Diapedium sexangulare, commonly known as the six-angled diapedium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive six-angled stems and palmate leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
